main event: On 1st December 1957, a large flash of light passed across the sky in the Argentia & St. Johns Area of Newfoundland, accompanied by a thunderous noise, with multiple military and civilian observers reporting the sighting.
interesting points: The flash of light appeared similar to an explosion, and witnesses heard a thunderous noise.
Multiple reports from both military and civilian sources indicate a large, bright object moving across the sky in an easterly direction.
Weather conditions in the area during the sightings were stable, ruling out lightning or thunder as the cause.
The object was estimated to be moving at a very high speed, and it changed color as it moved away from observers.
The object was reported to be three to four times larger than any visible star.
sighted object: large flash of light passing across the sky
witnesses: Military personnel, civilians including a local radio station manager and a seaman stationed at Argentia Naval Air Station
photographs: No photographs available in the report
